newHero.title: Your Journey to Canada Starts
newHero.tagline: Where your journey to Canadian immigration begins...
newHero.description: Expert guidance for your immigration needs. We help you navigate the path to your new life in Canada.

consultant.name: Burcu Akyol
consultant.title: Regulated Canadian Immigration Consultant (RCIC-IRB)
consultant.credential2: Board Member of the Canadian Association of Professional Immigration Consultants (CAPIC)
consultant.credential4: Commissioner for Taking Affidavits in Ontario
consultant.teamDescription: Northern Pathways is a team of immigrants, professionals, and educators who understand your journey.

home.heroDescription: Professional immigration assessment tools for Express Entry and Federal Skilled Worker Program. Get accurate scores and expert guidance for your Canadian immigration journey.

solutions.label: OUR SOLUTIONS
solutions.title: Comprehensive Immigration Solutions
solutions.description: We offer a wide array of services designed to make your journey to Canada as smooth and successful as possible.

expressEntry.title: Express Entry
expressEntry.description: We assist with Federal Skilled Worker (FSW), Canadian Experience Class (CEC), and Federal Skilled Trades (FST) programs. Our team helps you create a strong profile and navigate the Comprehensive Ranking System (CRS).

pnp.title: Provincial Nominee Programs (PNP)
pnp.description: Provincial Nominee Programs allow provinces and territories to nominate individuals who want to immigrate to Canada and who are interested in settling in a particular province or territory.

familySponsorship.title: Family Sponsorship
familySponsorship.description: Reunite with your family members in Canada. We guide you through the process of sponsoring your spouse, children, parents, or grandparents.

studyPermits.title: Study Permits
studyPermits.description: Pursue your education in Canada. We help you obtain study permits and navigate the process of studying at Canadian educational institutions.

workPermits.title: Work Permits
workPermits.description: Work in Canada with the right permits. We assist with work permit applications for various programs including LMIA-based and open work permits.

citizenship.title: Citizenship
citizenship.description: Become a Canadian citizen. We guide you through the citizenship application process and help you meet all requirements.

commitment.title: Our Commitment to Your Success
commitment.subtitle: We believe in a client-centric approach. Our process is built on a foundation of expertise, personalized strategy, and complete transparency.

regulated.title: Regulated & Authorized
regulated.description: [Placeholder] We are members in good standing of the CICC. This means we are authorized to represent you and are bound by a strict code of ethics, ensuring professional and ethical service.

personalized.title: Personalized Strategy
personalized.description: [Placeholder] You are not just a file number. We take the time to understand your unique situation, goals, and challenges to build a customized immigration plan that works specifically for you and your family.

transparent.title: Transparent & Honest
transparent.description: [Placeholder] We believe in transparency with zero hidden fees. We provide clear, flat-fee pricing and always give you an honest assessment of your chances and the best path forward.

about.title: About Northern Pathways
about.mission: Our mission is to provide clear, trustworthy, and effective immigration solutions. We understand this is more than paperwork—it's about your future.

testimonials.title: What Our Clients Say
testimonials.subtitle: Your success stories are our greatest reward. See what real clients have to say about their journey with us.

testimonial1.text: [Placeholder] We are so grateful to the Northern Pathways team. They made our dream of moving to Canada a reality. The process was so clear and they were always there to answer our questions.

testimonial2.text: [Placeholder] I received my study permit with no issues thanks to their diligent work. I was very confused about the process, but they simplified everything. Highly recommend!

testimonial3.text: [Placeholder] Professional, honest, and worth every penny. They gave me a clear path forward for my Express Entry profile when other consultants said it was impossible.

tools.label: FREE RESOURCES
tools.title: Immigration Tools & Calculators
tools.description: Get a better understanding of your options with our free estimation tools. For a full assessment, please book a consultation.

crsCard.title: Express Entry CRS Calculator
crsCard.description: [Placeholder] The Comprehensive Ranking System (CRS) is used to score Express Entry candidates. This tool helps you estimate your score based on age, education, work experience, and language skills.

fswpCard.title: Federal Skilled Worker Program Calculator
fswpCard.description: [Placeholder] The Federal Skilled Worker Program (FSWP) uses six selection factors to assess eligibility. This tool helps you calculate your points based on education, language, work experience, age, arranged employment, and adaptability.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Here are answers to some common questions. If you have other inquiries, our team is ready to assist you.

questions.q2: Am I eligible for Canadian immigration?
questions.q3: How long does the immigration process take?
questions.q4: What is a Provincial Nominee Program (PNP)?
questions.q5: Why do I need a Regulated Consultant (RCIC)?

answers.a1: [Placeholder] Express Entry is an online system used to manage applications for permanent residence from skilled workers. It includes the Federal Skilled Worker Program, the Federal Skilled Trades Program, and the Canadian Experience Class.
answers.a2: [Placeholder] Eligibility depends on various factors including age, education, work experience, language proficiency, and adaptability. Use our free calculators to assess your eligibility.
answers.a3: [Placeholder] Processing times vary depending on the program and individual circumstances. Express Entry applications typically take 6-8 months, while other programs may take longer.
answers.a4: [Placeholder] Provincial Nominee Programs allow Canadian provinces and territories to nominate individuals who want to immigrate to Canada and settle in a specific province or territory.
answers.a5: [Placeholder] A Regulated Canadian Immigration Consultant (RCIC) is authorized to represent you in immigration matters and is bound by a strict code of ethics, ensuring professional and ethical service.

step1.title: Pre-Assessment
step1.description: Complete our pre-assessment form to highlight potential application categories and understand your eligibility.

step2.title: Consultation Meeting
step2.description: Personalized consultations tailored to your specific profile and requirements. We are authorized to provide immigration consultation and representation services across Canada (excluding Quebec).

step3.title: Application
step3.description: Work together to plan each phase of your application process, aiming for the best outcomes and a seamless path to your new life in Canada.

educationPartner.title: EDUCATION & CAREER CONSULTING SOLUTION PARTNER
educationPartner.subtitle: Your trusted partner for educational and career guidance

features.crsDescription: Get precise Comprehensive Ranking System scores based on current IRCC guidelines and immigration criteria
features.fswpDescription: Comprehensive Federal Skilled Worker Program evaluation with detailed scoring breakdown
features.bilingualDescription: Available in English and Turkish for maximum accessibility and user convenience

howItWorks.subtitle: Simple steps to calculate your immigration score and assess your eligibility

howItWorks.step2Description: Our system calculates your CRS or FSWP score based on official criteria
howItWorks.step3Description: Understand your eligibility and get guidance for your immigration journey
howItWorks.readyToStart: Ready to get started? Choose your calculator below!
howItWorks.ctaDescription: Use our comprehensive calculators to assess your eligibility for Canadian immigration and take the first step towards your dream

draws.title: Latest Express Entry Draws
draws.subtitle: Most recent invitation rounds
draws.drawFrequencyText: Express Entry draws typically occur every 2 weeks, usually on Wednesdays. The exact schedule may vary based on IRCC's operational needs.
draws.crsScoreRangeText: CRS scores typically range from 400-600+ points. Higher scores increase your chances of receiving an Invitation to Apply (ITA).
draws.dataSourceText: This information is sourced from the Government of Canada's official Express Entry rounds page. For the most up-to-date and official information, please visit the
draws.liveDataFromGov: Live data from Government of Canada website
draws.license: Licence: Contains information licensed under the Open Government Licence – Canada
draws.useInfo: Use this information to understand current CRS score requirements

intro.title: Our Temporary Residence Services
intro.description: We provide expert guidance for your temporary stay in Canada, ensuring your application is strong and complete.

studyPermits.title: Study Permits
studyPermits.description1: Canada boasts a world-class education system. We can help you navigate the process of applying for a study permit, from choosing the right Designated Learning Institution (DLI) to preparing your letter of explanation and proving you have sufficient funds for your stay.
studyPermits.description2: We also guide you on your rights as a student, including your ability to work on or off-campus and your eligibility for a Post-Graduation Work Permit (PGWP) after you complete your studies.

whoFor.title: Who is this for?
whoFor.description: International students who have been accepted into a Canadian DLI (Designated Learning Institution).

processingTimes.title: Processing Times:
processingTimes.description: Varies by country. Can range from a few weeks to several months. We recommend applying as soon as you receive your letter of acceptance.

workPermits.title: Work Permits
workPermits.description1: Gaining Canadian work experience is a valuable step towards permanent residency. We assist with a variety of work permit applications, including those supported by a Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA), Post-Graduation Work Permits (PGWP) for eligible graduates, and spousal open work permits.
workPermits.description2: We'll help you and your employer navigate the complex requirements to ensure your application is submitted correctly.

whoFor.title: Who is this for?
whoFor.description: Foreign nationals who have a job offer from a Canadian employer, are recent graduates from a Canadian DLI, or are spouses of skilled workers or students.

keyTip.title: Key Tip:
keyTip.description: Most work permits require a valid job offer or LMIA *before* you can apply. A PGWP is a notable exception.

visitorVisas.title: Visitor & Super Visas
visitorVisas.description1: Whether you're looking to visit Canada for tourism, visit family, or attend a business meeting, you'll need a Visitor Visa (or eTA). We help you prepare a strong application that demonstrates your ties to your home country.
visitorVisas.description2: We also specialize in the **Super Visa**, which allows parents and grandparents of Canadian citizens and Permanent Residents to stay in Canada for up to five years at a time.

whoFor.title: Who is this for?
whoFor.description: Tourists, business visitors, and family members of Canadian residents. The Super Visa is specifically for parents and grandparents.

superVisaRequirement.title: Super Visa Requirement:
superVisaRequirement.description: Applicants must provide proof of Canadian medical insurance for at least one year and a letter of financial support from their child or grandchild.

process.title: Our Process
process.subtitle: How we guide you from start to finish.

assessment.title: Assessment
assessment.description: We start with a detailed consultation to assess your eligibility for the specific temporary visa you're seeking and discuss your goals.

applicationPrep.title: Application Prep
applicationPrep.description: We build your case, help you gather all required documents, and prepare a complete, professional application that strongly represents your case.

submissionSupport.title: Submission & Support
submissionSupport.description: We submit your application on your behalf and act as your representative with IRCC, handling any follow-up requests until a final decision is made.

hero.title: Economic Immigration
hero.subtitle: Pathways for skilled workers to build a life in Canada.

expressEntry.title: Express Entry
expressEntry.description: Express Entry is Canada's main system for managing skilled worker applications for permanent residence. We help you navigate its three main programs to maximize your score and chances of receiving an Invitation to Apply (ITA).

fsw.title: Federal Skilled Worker (FSW)
fsw.description1: This program is for skilled workers with foreign work experience who want to immigrate to Canada permanently. You must meet criteria for education, language proficiency, and have at least one year of continuous, full-time skilled work experience.
fsw.description2: We help you assess your eligibility, including the initial 67-point grid, and prepare your profile for the Express Entry pool.

whoFor.title: Who is this for?
whoFor.description: Skilled professionals (TEER 0, 1, 2, or 3) with at least one year of foreign work experience and high language scores (CLB 7+).

keyPoint.title: Key Point:
keyPoint.description: You must score at least 67/100 points on the Six Selection Factors grid *before* you can enter the Express Entry pool under this program.

fst.title: Federal Skilled Trades (FST)
fst.description1: This program is for skilled workers who are qualified in a specific skilled trade. It provides a pathway to permanent residence for individuals who can meet the demands of the Canadian labour market in trades like construction, manufacturing, and transportation.
fst.description2: Requirements include at least two years of full-time work experience in a skilled trade and a valid job offer OR a certificate of qualification from a Canadian province.

whoFor.title: Who is this for?
whoFor.description: Qualified tradespersons (e.g., welders, electricians, chefs, bakers) with 2+ years of experience and a job offer or Canadian qualification.

language.title: Language:
language.description: Requires a lower language score than FSW (CLB 5 for speaking/listening, CLB 4 for reading/writing).

cec.title: Canadian Experience Class (CEC)
cec.description1: This is an ideal pathway for individuals who have already studied or worked in Canada. The CEC program values your in-Canada experience, making it one of the most popular routes to permanent residence for temporary foreign workers and international student graduates.
cec.description2: You must have at least 12 months of full-time (or equivalent part-time) skilled work experience in Canada within the last 3 years.

whoFor.title: Who is this for?
whoFor.description: Individuals with at least one year of recent, skilled work experience *inside Canada*.

keyBenefit.title: Key Benefit:
keyBenefit.description: You do not need to show proof of settlement funds for the CEC program (unlike FSW and FST).

otherPathways.title: Other Immigration Pathways
otherPathways.description: Beyond Express Entry, Canada offers a variety of other programs for skilled individuals and entrepreneurs.

pnp.title: Provincial Nominee Program (PNP)
pnp.description: Most provinces and territories have their own "PNP" streams to nominate individuals who meet specific local labour market needs. A nomination adds 600 points to your Express Entry profile, virtually guaranteeing an ITA.

selfEmployed.title: Self-Employed Persons
selfEmployed.description: For individuals with relevant experience in cultural activities (e.g., artists, designers, musicians) or athletics (e.g., coaches, athletes) who can make a significant contribution to Canada.

startupVisa.title: Start-Up Visa
startupVisa.description: For immigrant entrepreneurs with the skills and potential to build an innovative business in Canada that can create jobs and compete on a global scale. Requires support from a designated Canadian entity.

newPathways.title: New Pathways (2025)
newPathways.description: The immigration landscape is always evolving. We stay on top of all policy changes and new pilot programs, such as category-based selection draws, to ensure you have access to the latest opportunities.

agrifood.title: Agri-food Immigration Pilot
agrifood.description: A pathway for experienced, non-seasonal workers in specific agriculture and food processing industries (like meat processing and mushroom production) to gain permanent residence.

atlantic.title: Atlantic Immigration Program
atlantic.description: A dedicated program for skilled workers and international graduates who want to live and work in one of Canada's four Atlantic provinces: New Brunswick, Nova Scotia, PEI, or Newfoundland and Labrador.

process.title: Our Process
process.subtitle: How we guide you from start to finish.

assessment.title: Assessment
assessment.description: We start with a detailed consultation to assess your eligibility for all economic pathways and determine your best strategy.

profileCreation.title: Profile Creation
profileCreation.description: We help you gather all required documents (language tests, ECA, etc.) and build a perfect Express Entry profile or PNP application.

postITA.title: Post-ITA Support
postITA.description: Once you receive an Invitation to Apply (ITA), we work quickly to submit your full application for Permanent Residence.

hero.title: Family Class
hero.subtitle: Reuniting families is at the heart of our mission.

spousalSponsorship.title: Spousal and Common-Law Partner Sponsorship
spousalSponsorship.description: Reuniting with your partner is a life-changing event. We provide complete application support for both inland and outland sponsorship applications, ensuring your file is prepared meticulously to avoid common pitfalls and delays.

inland.title: Spouse or Common-Law Partner in Canada Class (Inland)
inland.description: This pathway is for spouses or partners already in Canada with valid temporary status. One key benefit of the inland process is the ability to apply for an Open Work Permit.

outland.title: Family Class (Outland)
outland.description: This pathway is for sponsored partners living outside Canada. Note that "outland" applications can sometimes be submitted even if the partner is visiting Canada, and may offer faster processing times.

whoFor.title: Who is this for?
whoFor.description: Canadian citizens or Permanent Residents who wish to sponsor their spouse, common-law partner, or conjugal partner to Canada.

keyPoint.title: Key Point:
keyPoint.description: Proving the genuineness of your relationship is the most critical part of the application. We help you gather the right evidence.

otherFamilySponsorships.title: Other Family Sponsorships
otherFamilySponsorships.description: We also provide full support for other family reunification streams.

parentGrandparent.title: Parent & Grandparent Sponsorship
parentGrandparent.description: The PGP program is a popular, limited-intake lottery system. We help you prepare your application so you are ready to submit the moment the intake pool opens.

dependentChild.title: Dependent Child Sponsorship
dependentChild.description: Sponsor your biological or adopted child to come to Canada as a permanent resident. We can help you navigate the eligibility requirements for dependent children.

otherEligibleRelatives.title: Other Eligible Relatives
otherEligibleRelatives.description: In certain exceptional circumstances, you may be able to sponsor other relatives (like a sibling, niece, nephew, or grandchild) if you meet the "lonely Canadian" requirements.

process.title: Our Process
process.subtitle: How we guide you from start to finish.

eligibilityCheck.title: Eligibility Check
eligibilityCheck.description: We confirm the eligibility of both the sponsor and the person being sponsored, ensuring all financial and relationship requirements are met.

filePreparation.title: File Preparation
filePreparation.description: We help you build a strong case, focusing on proving the genuineness of your relationship with extensive documentation and supporting evidence.

submissionSupport.title: Submission & Support
submissionSupport.description: We submit the complete application and manage all communication with IRCC, providing updates and responding to any requests until a decision is made.

hero.title: Support for Canadian Employers
hero.subtitle: Navigating the process of hiring foreign talent.

labourShortages.title: Navigating Labour Shortages
labourShortages.description1: In a tight labour market, Canadian employers often look abroad to fill critical skill gaps. Hiring a temporary foreign worker can be an effective solution, but it involves complex legal obligations.
labourShortages.description2: We help employers navigate the entire process, from applying for a Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA) to ensuring you remain compliant with all government regulations. Our goal is to make the process as smooth as possible so you can focus on your business.

fillSkillGaps.title: Fill Skill Gaps
fillSkillGaps.description: Access a global talent pool to find the skilled workers you need.

ensureCompliance.title: Ensure Compliance
ensureCompliance.description: Navigate complex regulations and avoid penalties with expert guidance.

retainTalent.title: Retain Talent
retainTalent.description: Create long-term strategies to support your foreign workers on their path to permanent residence.

solutionsHub.title: Our Employer Solutions Hub
solutionsHub.description: Find the solution you need. We provide end-to-end support for LMIAs, LMIA-exempt permits, and ongoing compliance.

lmia.title: Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA)
lmia.description: An LMIA is a document from Service Canada that gives an employer permission to hire a temporary foreign worker. You must prove that there is a need for the worker and that no Canadian or permanent resident is available to do the job.
lmia.service2: Preparing and submitting the full LMIA application.
lmia.service3: Assisting with wage rate calculations and recruitment efforts.
lmia.service4: Guiding you through the transition to the worker's work permit application.

lmiaExempt.title: LMIA-Exempt Work Permits
lmiaExempt.description: Some work permits do not require an LMIA, based on international agreements or benefits to Canada. We can help you assess if your potential hire qualifies for one of these streams.

ict.title: Intra-Company Transferee (ICT)
ict.description: Transfer key employees from a foreign branch to a Canadian location.

francophone.title: Francophone Mobility Work Permit
francophone.description: Hire French-speaking skilled workers outside Quebec without an LMIA for specific TEER levels.

postDoc.title: Post-Doctoral Fellows (PhD Holders)
postDoc.description: Academic institutions can hire PhD holders using an LMIA exemption.

obligations.title: Employer Obligations for LMIA-Exempt Permits
obligations.description: Employers must submit an "Offer of Employment" and pay a compliance fee.

compliance.title: Employer Compliance
compliance.description: When you hire a temporary foreign worker, you are legally required to meet specific obligations regarding wages, working conditions, and keeping records. Non-compliance can lead to severe penalties, fines, and bans from the program.
compliance.help1: Conducting mock audits to ensure your files are inspection-ready.
compliance.help3: Providing representation during an official government compliance inspection.
compliance.help4: Assisting with applications to the Registered Employer Pilot program.

process.title: Our Process for Employers
process.subtitle: A clear, structured approach to meet your hiring needs.

strategySession.title: Strategy Session
strategySession.description: We start with a consultation to understand your business, your labour needs, and determine the best pathway (LMIA vs. LMIA-exempt).

filePreparation.title: File Preparation
filePreparation.description: We manage the entire application, from advising on recruitment and advertising to submitting the LMIA or Employer Portal offer.

complianceSupport.title: Compliance Support
complianceSupport.description: After approval, we guide you on your obligations as an employer and remain available for any compliance questions or audits.
